'http://www.itprocentral.com/quick-hint-listing-all-users-from-a-specific-ou-using-powershell/ Import-Module ActiveDirectory Get-ADUser -SearchBase “OU=Argentina,dc=apatricio,dc=local” -Filter * -ResultSetSize 5000 | Select Name,SamAccountName
e.g. Canonical name of object: jphsa.org/Generic Users
'These two examples work,with the description field: Import-Module ActiveDirectory Get-ADUser -SearchBase “OU=Generic Users,dc=JPHSA,dc=ORG” -Filter * -ResultSetSize 5000 | Select Name,SamAccountName,description | Format-list
Import-Module ActiveDirectory Get-ADUser -SearchBase “OU=Generic Users,dc=JPHSA,dc=ORG” -Filter * -ResultSetSize 5000 -Properties Description | Select *

about_POWERSHELL_DNS
#'Add a CNAME resource record #'This command adds a #' CNAME resource record #' with the alias labsrv1 #' to the contoso.com domain #' for a system named srv1 #' in the zone named lab.contoso.com.
#'WIN 2012 R2 PS C:\> Add-DnsServerResourceRecordCName -Name "labsrv1" -HostNameAlias "srv1.lab.contoso.com" -ZoneName "contoso.com"
-ComputerName #'Specifies a DNS server. #' If you do not specify this parameter, the command runs on the local system. #' You can specify an IP address or any value that resolves to an IP address, #' such as a fully qualified domain name (FQDN), host name, or NETBIOS name.
-HostNameAlias #'Specifies the FQDN of the host that gets the alias. This is the canonical name of the host.\
-Name #'Specifies the alias for the CNAME record
-ZoneName #'Specifies the name of a DNS zone.
===========================================================Set DNS server for a machine Set-DNSClientServerAddress -InterfaceAlias "Ethernet" -ServerAddresses 8.8.8.8

http://community.idera.com/powershell/ask_the_experts/f/active_directory__powershell_remoting-9/19436/get-adgroup-properties
get-adgroup -filter * -Properties Name,Description,ManagedBy,mail | select Name,Description,ManagedBy,mail | Export-Csv "C:\temp\ADGroups.csv" -NoTypeInformation -Delimiter ';' -Encoding utf8
--------------------------------------------------------------- #' This comes up in a very nice oop-up
get-adgroup -filter * -Properties Name,Description,ManagedBy,mail,CanonicalName | select Name,Description,ManagedBy,mail,CanonicalName | sort-object CanonicalName | Out-GridView

'# you may need to do this first: >Import-Module ActiveDirectory
'This gives you an idea of path Get-ADOrganizationalUnit –Filter * –properties * | Select DistinguishedName
'List of OU > Get-ADOrganizationalUnit –Filter * | Select Name
'List all the properties Get-ADOrganizationalUnit –Filter *
'w/ the domain name Get-ADOrganizationalUnit –Filter * –properties * | Select CanonicalName
